{{Use mdy dates|date=July 2016}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Emerson Hyndman | image = | image_size = | caption = | fullname = Emerson Schellas Hyndman<ref name="FIFA U-20 World Cup New Zealand 2015 List of Players">{{Cite web |title=FIFA U-20 World Cup New Zealand 2015 List of Players |url=http://www.fifadata.com/document/FWYC/2015/pdf/FWYC_2015_SquadLists.pdf |format=PDF |page=23 |publisher=[[FIFA]] |date=May 30, 2015 |accessdate=June 1, 2015}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1996|4|9}} <!--You don't need references for every one of these --> | birth_place = [[Dallas]], [[Texas]], United States | height = {{height|m=1.75}} | position = [[Central midfielder]] | currentclub = [[A.F.C. Bournemouth]] | clubnumber = 22 | youthyears1 = | youthclubs1 = Dallas Texans | youthyears2 = 2010–2011 | youthclubs2 = [[FC Dallas]] | youthyears3 = 2011–2014 | youthclubs3 = [[Fulham F.C. Academy|Fulham]] | years1 = 2014–2016 | clubs1 = [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] | caps1 = 25 | goals1 = 1 | years2 = 2016– | clubs2 = [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]] | caps2 = 1 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2017 | clubs3 = → [[Rangers F.C.|Rangers]] (loan) | caps3 = 13 | goals3 = 4 | years4 = 2018 | clubs4 = → [[Hibernian F.C.|Hibernian]] (loan) | caps4 = 15 | goals4 = 1 | pcupdate = 14:48, 1 January 2019 (UTC) | nationalyears1 = 2012 | nationalteam1 = [[United States men's national under-17 soccer team|United States U17]] | nationalcaps1 = 3 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2014–2015 | nationalteam2 = [[United States men's national under-20 soccer team|United States U20]] | nationalcaps2 = 14 | nationalgoals2 = 3 | nationalyears3 = 2014–2016 | nationalteam3 = [[United States men's national under-23 soccer team|United States U23]] | nationalcaps3 = 9 | nationalgoals3 = 1 | nationalyears4 = 2014– | nationalteam4 = [[United States men's national soccer team|United States]] | nationalcaps4 = 2 | nationalgoals4 = 0 | nationalteam-update = May 13, 2018 }} '''Emerson Schellas Hyndman''' (born April 9, 1996) is an American [[association football|soccer]] player who plays for [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|AFC Bournemouth]], and the [[United States men's national soccer team|United States national team]]. Hyndman, who plays as a [[midfielder]], has also previously played for [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]], [[Rangers F.C.|Rangers]] and [[Hibernian F.C.|Hibernian]].
==Club career==
Born in [[Dallas]], Hyndman started his career in the [[U.S. Soccer Development Academy]] with the Dallas Texans before moving on to joining [[FC Dallas]] in 2010.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fcdallas.com/post/2011/02/18/fc-dallas-signs-goalkeeper-richard-sanchez|title=FC Dallas signs goalkeeper Richard Sanchez|publisher=FC Dallas Website|date=February 18, 2011|accessdate=June 21, 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160621194546/http://www.fcdallas.com/post/2011/02/18/fc-dallas-signs-goalkeeper-richard-sanchez|archivedate=June 21, 2016|deadurl=no}}</ref> During his time at FC Dallas, Hyndman attracted interest from [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] after the club's director of football [[Dennis Wise]] saw him play, but ultimately Wise opted not to pursue him further.<ref>{{cite news|title=Five-a-side: What's hot around the league|url=http://www.mlssoccer.com/post/2010/01/23/five-side-whats-hot-around-league-11|publisher=Major League Soccer Website|date=January 23, 2010|accessdate=June 21, 2016}}</ref>
===Fulham=== Hyndman joined the [[Fulham F.C. Academy|Fulham youth academy]] in 2011 aged 15.<ref>[http://www.yanks-abroad.com/content.php?mode=show&id=10810 "HYNDMAN EMBRACES FULHAM LEGACY"], Yanks Abroad, August 20, 2013. Retrieved August 10, 2014.</ref> Hyndman revealed that the then club's head of youth development, Huw Jennings, convinced him to join the club.<ref>{{cite news|title=The Throw-In: "Fulhamerica" is gone, but does it matter?|url=http://www.mlssoccer.com/post/2012/12/20/throw-fulhamerica-gone-does-it-matter|publisher=Major League Soccer Website|date=December 20, 2012|accessdate=June 21, 2016}}</ref> Hyndman revealed that moving to England was tough initially, but that he soon settled in thanks to the club.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2013/march/22/hyndmans-homecoming|title=Hyndman's Homecoming|publisher=Fulham F.C.|date=March 22, 2013|accessdate=June 21, 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140420204010/http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2013/march/22/hyndmans-homecoming|archivedate=April 20, 2014 |deadurl=no}}</ref> In 2012, Hyndman signed his first professional contract with the club.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/kids-zone/ffc-news/2013/november/05/through-the-ranks-rodak|title=Through The Ranks: Emerson Hyndman|publisher=Fulham F.C.|date=November 5, 2013|accessdate=June 21, 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150912102028/http://www.fulhamfc.com/kids-zone/ffc-news/2013/november/05/through-the-ranks-rodak|archivedate=September 12, 2015 |deadurl=no}}</ref>
On August 9, 2014, Hyndman made his professional debut for [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] in a [[Football League Championship|Championship]] fixture against [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]], starting and playing 90 minutes in a 2–1 loss.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/28646535|title=Match Report|work=BBC.com|date=August 9, 2014}}</ref> In his first season at Fulham, Hyndman made nine league appearances, due to playing in the reserves, being on the substitute bench and being sidelined with a broken collarbone.<ref>{{cite news|title=Sources: Emerson Hyndman sidelined with broken collarbone|url=http://www.goal.com/en-us/news/66/united-states/2015/01/29/8428482/sources-emerson-hyndman-sidelined-with-broken-collarbone|publisher=Goal.com|date=January 29, 2015|accessdate=June 21, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2015/march/19/hyndman-cottage-return|title=Hyndman: Cottage Return|publisher=Fulham F.C.|date=March 19, 2015|accessdate=June 21, 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151028061833/http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2015/march/19/hyndman-cottage-return|archivedate=October 28, 2015 |deadurl=no}}</ref>
In the 2015–16 season, it was reported by [[Goal.com]] that Hyndman turned down a contract extension twice with the club, leading to attracting interests.<ref>{{cite news|title=American Exports: U-20 standout Emerson Hyndman turns down extension offers with Fulham|url=http://www.mlssoccer.com/post/2015/08/05/american-exports-u-20-standout-emerson-hyndman-turns-down-extension-offers-fulham|publisher=MLSsoccer.com|date=August 5, 2015|accessdate=June 21, 2016}}</ref> By September, Hyndman would stay at the club.<ref>{{cite news|title=Sources: Emerson Hyndman to stay at Fulham|url=http://www.goal.com/en-us/news/66/united-states/2015/08/31/14927412/sources-emerson-hyndman-to-stay-at-fulham|publisher=Goal.com|date=August 31, 2015|accessdate=June 21, 2016}}</ref> Hyndman made his first appearance of 2015–16 season, playing 90 minutes, in a 1–0 loss against [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] in the third round of [[2015–16 Football League Cup|League Cup]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Fulham 0-1 Stoke City: Peter Crouch puts Potters through in Capital One Cup|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/fulham-vs-stoke/351310|publisher=Sky Sports|date=September 22, 2015|accessdate=June 21, 2016}}</ref> After spending months in the reserves, Hyndman's first league appearance came on December 5, 2015, coming on as a substitute, in a 3–0 loss against [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Nottingham Forest 3-0 Fulham|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/34951381|publisher=BBC Sport|date=December 5, 2015|accessdate=June 21, 2016}}</ref> Following this, Hyndman was given a string of regular first team football, though he was left out of the starting eleven on more than one occasion when Fulham faced relegation.<ref>{{cite news|title=Fulham boss on Emerson Hyndman – and why USA international is being kept out of harm's way|url=http://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulham-boss-emerson-hyndman-usa-11036567|publisher=Get West London|date=March 14, 2016|accessdate=June 21, 2016}}</ref> Despite this, Hyndman scored his first professional goal against [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] on his 20th birthday.<ref>{{cite news|title=Fulham 2–1 Cardiff City|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35948814|publisher=BBC Sport|date=April 9, 2016|accessdate=June 21, 2016}}</ref> After the match, in which he scored the winning goal, Hyndman was named Man of the Match for his performance.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2016/april/11/man-of-the-match-result|title=Man Of The Match Result|publisher=Fulham F.C.|date=April 11, 2016|accessdate=June 21, 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160621211146/http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2016/april/11/man-of-the-match-result|archivedate=June 21, 2016|deadurl=no}}</ref>
At the end of the season, manager [[Slaviša Jokanović]] stated Hyndman could leave the club with his blessing<ref>{{cite news|title=Fulham manager maintains neither Manchester United target Moussa Dembele nor Emerson Hyndman will leave with his blessing|url=http://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fulham-manager-maintains-neither-manchester-10744706|publisher=Get West London|date=January 17, 2016|accessdate=June 21, 2016}}</ref> On May 15, 2016, [[ESPN]] reported that Hyndman would leave Fulham when his contract expires, although it revealed that Fulham would get compensation as a result for Hyndman's departure.<ref>{{cite news|title=Emerson Hyndman to leave Fulham in summer, according to source|url=http://www.espnfc.co.uk/fulham/story/2873709/emerson-hyndman-to-leave-fulham-in-summer-source|publisher=ESPN|date=June 15, 2016|accessdate=June 21, 2016}}</ref>
===AFC Bournemouth=== ====2016–17: loan to Rangers==== On June 17, 2016, Hyndman signed a four-year deal with [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|AFC Bournemouth]] of the [[Premier League]]. He made his first appearance in a League Cup match against [[Morecambe F.C.|Morecambe]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37103116|title=Morecambe 1-2 Bournemouth |publisher=BBC Sport|date=24 August 2016|accessdate=4 November 2016}}</ref>
On January 9, 2017, Hyndman signed for [[Scottish Premiership]] club [[Rangers F.C.|Rangers]] until the end of the [[2016–17 Scottish Premiership|2016–17 season]].<ref>{{ cite news | url=https://rangers.co.uk/news/headlines/hyndman-joins-gers/ | title=Hyndman Joins The Gers | date=9 January 2017| work=Rangers.co.uk | publisher=Rangers Football Club }}</ref><ref>{{ cite news | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38548416| title=Emerson Hyndman: Rangers complete loan deal for Bournemouth midfielder| publisher=BBC Sport | date=9 January 2017 | first=Richard | last=Wilson }}</ref> Hyndman made his Rangers debut in a [[Scottish Cup]] win over [[Motherwell F.C.|Motherwell]] at [[Ibrox Stadium]] on 21 January 2017,<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38620153 | title=Rangers 2-1 Motherwell| publisher=BBC Sport | date=21 January 2017 |first=Andy |last=Campbell| accessdate=21 January 2017}}</ref> and scored his first goal for the club against the same opponents a week later.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://spfl.co.uk/premiership/fixture/3638014/|title=Motherwell 0-2 Rangers|publisher=SPFL|date=28 January 2017|accessdate=28 January 2017}}</ref> He was selected as [[Rangers F.C.|Rangers]] Young Player of the Year for [[2016–17 Rangers F.C. season|2016–17]], despite only joining the club in January.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.thescottishsun.co.uk/sport/football/908342/wes-foderingham-clint-hill-kenny-miller-find-out-who-won-rangers-player-of-the-year/ | title=SIMPLY THE BEST Wes Foderingham, Clint Hill, Kenny Miller? Find out who won Rangers Player of the Year | work=[[The Scottish Sun]] | date=23 April 2017 | accessdate=22 April 2017}}</ref>
====2017–18==== Hyndman returned to Bournemouth after his loan spell with Rangers, but made limited appearances during the 2017–18 season. He appeared in one [[EFL Cup]] tie and two [[FA Cup]] matches, then made his [[Premier League]] debut in May 2018.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.bournemouthecho.co.uk/sport/16225285.Premier_League_debut_will_do_Hyndman___39_the_world_of_good__39_/ |title=Premier League debut will do Hyndman 'the world of good' |work=Bournemouth Echo |publisher= |date=14 May 2018 |accessdate=8 August 2018}}</ref>
====2018–19: loan to Hibernian==== Hyndman was loaned to Scottish Premiership club [[Hibernian F.C.|Hibernian]] in August 2018, on a deal due to run until January 2019.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45121851 |title=Emerson Hyndman: Bournemouth midfielder joins Hibernian on loan |work= |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 August 2018 |accessdate=8 August 2018}}</ref> He scored his first goal for the club in a 6–0 win against [[Hamilton Academical]] on 6 October 2018.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45688828|title=Hibernian 6-0 Hamilton |publisher=BBC Sport |date=6 October 2018|accessdate=7 October 2018}}</ref> Hyndman returned to Bournemouth at the end of his loan with Hibernian.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46729230 |title=Emerson Hyndman: Bournemouth midfielder returns from Hibernian at end of loan spell |work= |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 January 2019 |accessdate=1 January 2019}}</ref>
==International career== Hyndman represented the United States at [[United States men's under-17 national soccer team|under-17]] level in 2012.<ref>http://www.ussoccer.com/us-under17-mens-national-team/stats/2012-statistics</ref> He received his first senior call up in August 2014 after making three first team appearances for Fulham.<ref>{{cite news|title=Seattle Sounders academy attacker Jordan Morris, World Cup vet Julian Green highlight USMNT roster vs. Czech Republic|url=http://www.mlssoccer.com/post/2014/08/28/seattle-sounders-academy-attacker-jordan-morris-world-cup-vet-julian-green-highlight|publisher=MLS Soccer Website|date=August 28, 2014}}</ref> On August 28, 2014, he was selected to the [[United States men's national soccer team|senior national team]] for their game against the [[Czech Republic national football team|Czech Republic]] on September 3.<ref>{{cite news|title=Geoff Cameron ruled out of US national team for friendly in Czech Republic|url=http://www.mlssoccer.com/post/2014/08/31/geoff-cameron-ruled-out-us-national-team-friendly-czech-republic|publisher=MLS Website|date=August 31, 2014|accessdate=June 21, 2016}}</ref> He made his senior team debut during the match, being subbed on in the 67th minute.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2014/september/04/hyndmans-us-debut|title=Emerson Hyndman's US Debut|publisher=Fulham F.C.|date=September 4, 2014|accessdate=June 21, 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140909110819/http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2014/september/04/hyndmans-us-debut|archivedate=September 9, 2014 |deadurl=no}}</ref>
In May 2015, Hyndman captained the [[United States men's national under-20 soccer team|United States]] side in the [[2015 FIFA U-20 World Cup]] in New Zealand. In his first match of the tournament, Hyndman scored the game winner to defeat [[Myanmar national under-20 football team|Myanmar]] 2–1.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ussoccer.com/stories/2015/05/30/01/13/150530-u20mnt-v-mya-gamestory|title=U-20 MNT KICKS OFF 2015 U-20 WORLD CUP WITH 2-1 WIN OVER MYANMAR|work=USSoccer.com}}</ref>
==Personal life== Hyndman is the grandson of former [[FC Dallas]] manager [[Schellas Hyndman]].<ref name="American Exports">{{cite web|title=American Exports: Emerson Hyndman stars in Fulham's win vs. Chelsea in FA Youth Cup final|url=http://www.mlssoccer.com/news/article/2014/04/28/american-exports-emerson-hyndman-stars-fulhams-1st-leg-win-fa-youth-cup-fina|website=MLS Soccer|publisher=MLS|accessdate=August 9, 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140429134901/http://www.mlssoccer.com/news/article/2014/04/28/american-exports-emerson-hyndman-stars-fulhams-1st-leg-win-fa-youth-cup-fina|archivedate=April 29, 2014 }}</ref> He holds Portuguese citizenship through his family history.<ref name=Homecoming>{{cite web|title=Emerson Hyndman Has Homecoming at Dallas Cup|url=http://americansoccernow.com/articles/emerson-hyndman-has-homecoming-at-dallas-cup|publisher=American Soccer Now LLC|accessdate=August 9, 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140809172422/http://americansoccernow.com/articles/emerson-hyndman-has-homecoming-at-dallas-cup|archivedate=August 9, 2014}}</ref>
While growing up in United States, Hyndman excelled in baseball, basketball and soccer, but preferred soccer, as he stated he loved kicking a ball from a young age.<ref>{{cite news|title=Emerson Hyndman|url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/kids-zone/academy-access/emerson-hyndman|publisher=Fulham F.C.|date=April 3, 2013|accessdate=June 21, 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160621202324/http://www.fulhamfc.com/kids-zone/academy-access/emerson-hyndman|archivedate=June 21, 2016|deadurl=no}}</ref>
==Career statistics== ===Club=== {{updated|14:48, 1 January 2019 (UTC)}}<ref>{{Soccerbase|id=76795}}</ref>
